column4: I'm having issues connect to the internet with my Ubuntu server. If I create a new static ip and then reboot, it will be able to connect to the inter for about 3 minutes and then I get 'host cannot be found'. I can then change my ip address again repeat the process exactly like the first time. Any ideas what is going on?
driver issue maybe?
I can ping anything within my network
but that's it
only for the first 3minutes or so
sounds like a network manager problem  maybe try stop it
try sudo service network-manager stop
unrecognized service
stop letting network-manager mess you up,  I've seen it alot kill it
or did you try starting dhclient that would do the same thing if it continued to run
is that when it's not working?  that looks good
ok I missed that ya the bottom is bad like the network was down and up again without route added
I'm not sure what this means exactly. Any ideas what could be causing this?
what does your /etc/network/interfaces file look like?
yes many things could cause that if that's what you told the interface to do
http://pastie.org/1693443
that looks good to me not sure why it would do that then
unless one of the other network mangers are running like wicd or network-manger or ??
this is the server edition. I'm not sure what is installed by default, but I haven't installed any. I set this up manually.
did you try the stop command I gave you before?
which?
sudo service network-manager stop
but even if it was running it shouldn't cause a problem with what I see in you interfaces file so what else could be changing it?
s5fs: thanks for the help. I'm going to look into a few things and if I continue to have the problem I'll repost with summary of our results. thx
